episodes.title: High court orders fresh statement from accused as state witness in Shakahola massacre case
episodes.description: The high court in Mombasa has directed one of the accused persons in the Shakahola massacre murder case to record fresh statements as state witness

episodes.title: Late GSU officer Isaac Ngala buried at his home in Malindi
episodes.description: Isaac Ngala, the late GSU officer who died in the Shakahola tragedy two years ago, has finally been laid to rest in Muyeye village, Malindi constituency.

episodes.title: Shakahola massacre | Families continue receiving victims’ remains after two years
episodes.description: Families of victims of the Shakahola massacre on Thursday continued collecting the remains of their loved ones at the Malindi mortuary. One more family received four bodies after two agonising years of waiting. So far, 16 bodies have been released to families who are now preparing for burial. Human rights groups say at least 60 victims have been positively identified, while more than 300 bodies remain unclaimed

episodes.title: Shakahola victims’ families begin burials as government pledges support with transport and fees
episodes.description: Families of victims of the Shakahola massacre have continued to collect bodies of their loved ones from the Malindi mortuary. Out of 34 bodies, 10 have so far been handed over to families that are now preparing for burial. The government says it will assist the families with the transportation of bodies and waiving of mortuary fees, the burden of conducting burials has remained a challenge.

episodes.title: 13 fresh graves unearthed in Kwa Binzaro, Kilifi County
episodes.description: Homicide detectives in Malindi have discovered more graves in the Kwa Binzaro area, near Shakahola. The detectives who returned to the scene where eight graves had been found three weeks earlier have identified thirteen more graves, raising the total to 21.

episodes.title: Govt to bury 300+ unclaimed Shakahola bodies, says Murkomen
episodes.description: The government plans to inter all unidentified bodies exhumed from Shakahola, Kilifi County, after it emerged that the process of identification through DNA samples is taking longer than expected. Interior and national administration cabinet secretary Kipchumba Murkomen says, families have not presented themselves, hindering the conclusion of this process. Over 300 bodies are yet to be identified

episodes.title: Court approves exhumation in Malindi cult case as Shakahola hearings continue
episodes.description: The Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) has been granted permission by a Malindi court to exhume bodies believed to be buried in shallow graves at Kwa Binzaro area in Kilifi County. In a court directive, Resident Magistrate Irene Thamari instructed Chief Government Pathologist Dr. Johansen Oduor and the homicide unit to lead the exhumation exercise. The operation will include postmortem examinations, DNA testing, and toxicological analysis aimed at establishing the exact causes of death. The manslaughter case against controversial pastor Paul Mackenzie and 94 others continued with two prosecution witnesses testifying in Mombasa.

episodes.title: Malindi cult fears grow as 48 reported Missing, secret burials suspected
episodes.description: Fears that six children from one family are among dozens who have died in what appears to be a fresh wave of the shakahola massacre. A close relative, who spoke to the children’s parents and the leaders suspected to be behind this second round of killings says the parents themselves confirmed the deaths. Human rights activists now claim more than forty people could have been killed and secretly buried in kwa Binzaro since March.

episodes.title: 11 suspects linked to a cult in Kilifi detained
episodes.description: CitizenTV Live

episodes.title: Another cult in Shakahola?
episodes.description: TONIGHT, DISTURBING DEVELOPMENTS OUT OF KILIFI COUNTY ARE REIGNITING FEARS THAT THE HORROR OF THE SHAKAHOLA TRAGEDY MAY NOT BE OVER. ALMOST TWO YEARS SINCE THE HORRIFYING DISCOVERY OF MASS GRAVES IN SHAKAHOLA FOREST,THERE ARE RENEWED CASES OF CULT-PRACTICES  AFTER  AUTHORITIES  RECOVERED ONE BODY AND RESCUED FOUR EMACIATED INDIVIDUALS , JUST KILOMETERS FROM THE ORIGINAL SHAKAHOLA SITE. EVEN MORE UNSETTLING, AMONG THOSE ARRESTED ARE A HUSBAND AND WIFE WHO ARE FORMER VICTIMS OF THE SHAKAHOLA CULT, WHO VANISHED FROM THEIR HOME IN SIAYA COUNTY AND RETURNED TO THE FOREST

episodes.title: Family in search of kin who joined cult-like church
episodes.description: Pauline Adhiambo is said to have joined the sect in 2002
subjects: Melkio St Joseph Missions of Messiah Africa Church

episodes.title: Police arrest leaders of controversial church in Kilifi
episodes.description: Gandi is founder of New Foundation Church

episodes.title: Rongo 57 'sect' members to remain in police custody for 30 days
episodes.description: Police seal off St.Joseph Missions of Messiah Africa Church

episodes.title: Rongo ‘Sect’ Probe:  CS Murkomen says all chiefs will be held accountable
episodes.description:
Murkormen: We’ll engage all chiefs, sub-chiefs in that area

Police seal off St. Joseph Missions of Messaiha Africa Church
subjects: Melkio St Joseph Missions of Messiah Africa Church

episodes.title: Rongo church closed
episodes.description:
There was Drama at the Rongo Police Station in Migori county after 57 faithful of Melkio St. Joseph Missions of Messaiha Africa Church refused to go home, insisting that they could only return to their church, where two members reportedly perished after refusing to seek medical attention. Migori County Commissioner Mutua Kiilu revealed that there were registration anomalies while setting up the facility, which remains cordoned off by police officers undertaking investigations amid reports of Cult-LIKE activities associated with the Church.
#CitizenTV #citizendigital
subjects: Melkio St Joseph Missions of Messiah Africa Church

episodes.title: "Cult" in Migori
episodes.description: Police in Migori County have recovered two bodies at St. Joseph Mission of Africa, church is located at Kochola village in Rongo sub-county. 57 other people believed to be faithful to the church were rescued by the police in what is suspected to be indoctrination-driven habits. Police say the congregants are defiant about undergoing medical checks as they chanted and sang religious songs.
subjects: Melkio St Joseph Missions of Messiah Africa Church

episodes.title: Shakahola cult leader Paul Mackenzie and the co-accused persons remanded for 47 more days
State wants court order to force-feed 65 Shakahola cult suspects currently on hunger strike
episodes.description: State wants court order to force-feed 65 Shakahola cult suspects currently on hunger strike.

episodes.title: 16 Shakahola cult members weak after a 10 day hunger strike
episodes.description: 16 Shakahola mass murder suspects in police custody have grown increasingly weak after embarking on a hunger strike for the last 10 days.

episodes.title: 16 Shakahola starvation cult suspects currently on hunger strike arraigned at Shanzu Law Court
episodes.description: 16 Shakahola starvation cult suspects currently on hunger strike arraigned at Shanzu Law Court

episodes.title: Shakahola mass murder death toll hits 303
episodes.description: The number of bodies exhumed from Shakahola forest has surpassed the 300 mark after investigators exhumed 19 bodies today. Homicide detectives went back to Kwa Mugambi area where several bodies were recovered at the start of the operation. On Wednesday investigators are expected near Paul Mackenzie’s home after more graves were discovered.

episodes.title: How controversial pastor Paul Mackenzie acquired the Shakahola cult farm using elders
episodes.description:
Tonight, we unravel how controversial pastor Paul Mackenzie acquired the Shakahola cult farm using elders from the 5 clan groups that claim ownership of more than 100,000 acres of the Chakama ranch in Kilifi County. Emmanuel Mwaro one of the signatories to an agreement says Mackenzie doesn’t own the land but only paid 500,000 shillings for a one-year stay commonly known as Kajama. 
In an exclusive agreement in our possession Mackenzie initially wanted to settle in and use 800 acres before changing his mind and opting for a 500-acre piece of land. And as Francis Mtalaki reports top security officers were aware of the transactions and at some point accompanied Mackenzie for his mission in the forest.

episodes.title: Interior CS says children were sexually abused in Shakahola Cult
episodes.description: Interior CS Professor Kithure Kindiki says detectives probing the massacre have uncovered sexual abuse and exploitation of little girls in Shakahola. The Interior CS say detectives have identified the shanties where the sexual orgy took place, adding that investigations have commenced establishing the extent of the abuses. Prof. Kindiki also confirmed fears of organ harvesting, saying that some of the bodies exhumed were missing body parts. Kindiki was responding to Members of the Senate Ad hoc committee investigating the Shakahola deaths

episodes.title: Man reveals how lives of emaciated sect members were ended in Shakahola
episodes.description: It is now emerging that controversial preacher Paul Mackenzie was conducting funerals for his deceased followers. This shocking new revelation comes from a former follower who says more than 1,500 people who trooped to Shakahola forest were not only conned to buy land but also brainwashed to fast to death. Mackenzie's former follower agreed to share his story with Citizen TV.

episodes.title: DAY BREAK | Shakahola horror (Part 2)
episodes.description: DAY BREAK | Shakahola horror (Part 2)
